title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: This table presents 2024 enrollment statistics for children in Arunachal Pradesh, categorized by age groups (6-14, 7-16, 15-16) and sex. It details the percentage distribution of students across government schools, private schools, and other educational institutions, as well as the percentage of children not currently enrolled in school.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Data from 2022 showing the educational status of young children (ages 3 to 8) in Arunachal Pradesh. It breaks down enrollment into pre-school categories (Anganwadi, Govt pre-primary, Pvt LKG/UKG), formal schooling (Govt, Pvt, Other), and those not enrolled in any institution.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Data from 2024 showing the educational status of young children (ages 3 to 8) in Arunachal Pradesh. It breaks down enrollment into pre-school categories (Anganwadi, Govt pre-primary, Pvt LKG/UKG), formal schooling (Govt, Pvt, Other), and those not enrolled in any institution, allowing for comparison with 2022 data.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/ UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: A 2024 assessment of reading proficiency for children in Arunachal Pradesh across Grades I through VIII. The table displays the percentage of students at different reading milestones: recognizing letters, reading words, reading Standard I level text, and reading Standard II level text.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time
description: Longitudinal trend analysis (2014-2024) of reading skills for Standard III students in Arunachal Pradesh. It specifically tracks the percentage of children who can read Standard II level text, comparing performance in Government versus Private schools over the decade.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 6: Trends over time
description: Multi-year comparison (2014-2024) of foundational reading abilities for students in Standard V and Standard VIII in Arunachal Pradesh. The table shows the percentage of students in these higher grades who can read Standard II level text, segmented by Government and Private school enrollment.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text |
| Year | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* |

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: A 2024 numeracy assessment for students in Grades I through VIII in Arunachal Pradesh. It categorizes children based on their highest arithmetic capability, ranging from number recognition (1-9, 10-99) to performing subtraction and division.

title: Table 8: Trends over time
description: Historical trend data (2014-2024) regarding the arithmetic skills of Standard III students in Arunachal Pradesh. It tracks the percentage of children capable of doing at least subtraction, broken down by government and private school sectors.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction |

title: Table 9: Trends over time
description: Time-series data (2014-2024) illustrating the division competency of Standard V and Standard VIII students in Arunachal Pradesh. The table compares the percentage of students who can perform division in government versus private schools over time.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division |

title: Table 10: Smartphone availability and use. By age. 2024

title: Table 11: Smartphone availability and use among 14-16-year-olds. By sex. 2024
description: Gender-based comparison of smartphone access and ownership for children aged 14-16 in Arunachal Pradesh (2024). It highlights disparities between boys and girls regarding home availability, ability to use devices for digital tasks, and personal ownership.

title: Table 12: Of those who know how to use a smartphone, % children who used a smartphone in the reference week for any educational activity and social media activity, and know how to use safety features. By age. 2024
description: Survey of usage patterns and digital safety awareness among smartphone-using children aged 14-16 in Arunachal Pradesh (2024). title: Table 15: Trends over time
description: Sample size details for school surveys conducted in Arunachal Pradesh across selected years (2010, 2018, 2022, 2024), categorized by the number of primary and upper primary schools visited.

title: Table 16: Trends over time
description: Trends in student and teacher attendance rates in Arunachal Pradesh schools, comparing average presence percentages across survey years from 2010 to 2024.

title: Table 17: Trends over time
description: Trends regarding school size in Arunachal Pradesh (2010-2024), specifically tracking the percentage of schools meeting specific small-enrollment criteria over time.

title: Table 18: Multigrade classes. 2024

title: Table 19: Observation of TLM (Teaching Learning Materials) in classrooms. 2024

title: Table 20: Trends over time
description: Comprehensive infrastructure survey of Arunachal Pradesh schools (2010-2024), tracking the availability and usability of facilities including mid-day meals, drinking water, toilets (general and girls'), libraries, electricity, and computers.
data: | Mid-day meal | Mid-day meal served in school on the day of visit | 47.1 | 36.2 | 51.3 | 57.2 |
| Mid-day meal | Kitchen/shed for cooking mid-day meal | 64.0 | 57.4 | 57.1 | 59.8 |
| Drinking water | No facility for drinking water | 36.9 | 35.9 | 24.4 | 26.9 |
| Drinking water | Facility but no drinking water available | 9.9 | 19.5 | 13.7 | 14.3 |
| Toilet | Facility but toilet not useable | 53.9 | 38.0 | 26.9 | 37.0 |
| Girls' toilet | No separate provision for girls' toilet | 60.4 | 42.3 | 35.6 | 31.5 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision but locked | 11.3 | 16.8 | 10.2 | 15.8 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked but not useable | 16.2 | 12.8 | 10.7 | 15.2 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked and useable | 12.2 | 28.2 | 43.6 | 37.6 |
| Library | Library but no books being used by children on the day of visit | 6.7 | 19.6 | 16.1 | 13.2 |
| Library | Library books being used by children on the day of visit | 6.3 | 4.4 | 5.9 | 9.3 |
| Electricity | Of schools with electricity connection, % schools with electricity available on the day of visit |  | 46.2 | 68.6 | 65.1 |
| Computer | No computer available for children to use | 85.7 | 92.3 | 86.3 | 83.5 |
| Computer | Computer available but not being used by children on the day of visit | 6.4 | 6.4 | 9.8 | 10.4 |
| Computer | Computer being used by children on the day of visit | 8.0 | 1.3 | 3.9 | 6.0 |
